Rattrap cringes inside Night Shift's cab.  He buckles himself in, now knowi=
ng what was ahead.

" I don't like the looks of this, those signatures spel=
l trouble, buddy."

Night Shift stops short for a moment to try and think t=
hings through.

" Neither do I, but there's a chance Cheetor's in there and=
 we just can't turn tail on 'em. Hmm...  I think this calls for a little Ni=
njabot finesse.  If I trade in my wheels for feet, I could get us in there =
like a pair of ghosts in the smog.  No one would know we're there, and we c=
ould get a better look at what's go'n on."

Rattrap nodds.

"I don't wanna =
but it's a good idea.  You're right.  I can't rat my way outa this, we gott=
a help Cheetor.  Okay, I'll step out."

He steps out of Night Shift's cab a=
s the Autobot goes from vehicle to robot mode in a matter of seconds.  Rat =
Trap then gets up on his shoulder and holds onto his helmet with tiny paws.=
  Night Shift gives him a reassuring look.

"No worries Rattrap we can do t=
his."

Quietly, Night Shift moves in as he silently takes to the forest, on=
 swift and silent feet.
